info.title: Storefront Token
info.description:
- [OAuth Scopes](#oauth-scopes)
- [Authentication](#authentication)
- [Available Endpoints](#available-endpoints)
- [Creating Customer Impersonation Tokens](#creating-customer-impersonation-tokens)
- [Revoking Tokens](#revoking-tokens)

An OpenAPI Document for Storefront API Token generation via Bigcommerce v3 API. 

## OAuth Scopes
| UI Name                                      | Permission | Parameter                                     |
|----------------------------------------------|------------|-----------------------------------------------|
| Storefront API Customer Impersonation Tokens | manage     | `store_storefront_api_customer_impersonation` |
| Storefront API Tokens                        | manage     | `store_storefront_api`                        |

For more information on OAuth Scopes, see: [Authentication](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/getting-started/authentication).

## Authentication

Requests can be authenticated by sending a `client_id` and `access_token` via `X-Auth-Client` and `X-Auth-Token` HTTP headers:

```http
GET /stores/{$$.env.store_hash}/v3/catalog/summary
host: api.bigcommerce.com
Accept: application/json
X-Auth-Client: {client_id}
X-Auth-Token: {access_token}
```

|Header|Parameter|Description|
|-|-|-|
|`X-Auth-Client`|`client_id`|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|
|`X-Auth-Token`|`access_token `|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|

For more information on Authenticating BigCommerce APIs, see: [Authentication](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/getting-started/authentication).

## Available Endpoints
| Resource / Endpoint                     | Description                                                             |
|-----------------------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Storefront API Token                    | Create Auth Tokens for use with Storefront APIs                         |
| Storefront Customer Impersonation Token | Create a storefront API token for customer impersonation                |

## Creating Customer Impersonation Tokens
Its possible to generate tokens for use in server-to-server interactions with a trusted consumer by POSTing to the API Token Customer Impersonation Endpoint with the X-Bc-Customer-Id header set to the customerâ€™s ID:

```http
POST /stores/{$$.env.store_hash}/v3/storefront/api-token-customer-impersonation
host: api.bigcommerce.com
x-Auth-Client: {client_id}
x-Auth-Token: {access_token}
X-Bc-Customer-Id: {customer_id}
```

## Revoking Tokens
To revoke tokens, send a `DELETE` request to the Revoke a Token endpoint and include the `JWT` in the `Sf-Api-Token` header

```http
DELETE /stores/{$$.env.store_hash}/v3/storefront/api-token-customer-impersonation
host: api.bigcommerce.com
x-Auth-Client: {client_id}
x-Auth-Token: {access_token}
Sf-Api-Token: {customer_id}
```

info.title: Storefront Carts
info.description:
### Cart
The Storefront Cart does not use API Tokens and allows for cart data to be scraped directly from the front end or used in a Stencil Theme.

Notes:
- The Try It Now at each endpoint will not work. Please see [Cart and Checkout](/api-docs/cart-and-checkout/cart-and-checkout-overview) for a script that can be used to get Cart details.
- cartId is the same as the checkoutId.
- Carts are valid for 30 days after the last modification. A modification includes the initial cart creation or editing the existing cart.
- Redirect URLs can be generated only from carts created using the server-to-server cart API. To restore a cart that was created on the storefront--either by a shopper or the Storefront Cart API--first recreate the cart using the server-to-server Cart API.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
To return product options add one of the following include:

`lineItems.physicalItems.options`: The Cart returns an abbreviated result. Use this to return physical items product options. Can also be used in a /POST to have the extended Cart object return.

`lineItems.digitalItems.options`:  The Cart returns an abbreviated result. Use this to return digital items product options.  Can also be used in a /POST to have the extended Cart object return.

`lineItems.digitalItems.options,lineItems.physicalItems.options`:  The Cart returns an abbreviated result. Use this to return digital and physical options. Can also be used in a /POST to have the extended Cart object return.

200.description:
Gets an empty list if no cart exists in the session, or the cart if the shopper has an active cart.
A custom item can only be added to a cart using the Server to Server Cart API.

data.description: A cart contains a collection of items, prices, discounts, etc. It does not contain customer-related data.

items.description:
A cart contains a collection of items, prices, discounts, etc. It does not contain customer-related data.
Custom Items is a read only field. A custom item can only be added to a cart using the Server to Server Cart API.

currency.description: This will always be the same between cart and checkout.

baseAmount.description: Cost of cart's contents, before applying discounts.

discountAmount.description: Discounted amount.

|-|-|

|`5`|`promotion`|

get.description:
Returns a *Cart*. 

By default, the cart response will return abbreviated details for cart line items. To get full details of selected product options, use the following query parameters: 

- Physical products only: `?include=lineItems.physicalItems.options `
- Digital products only: `?include=lineItems.digitalItems.options`
- Both physical and digital items: `?include=lineItems.digitalItems.options,lineItems.physicalItems.options`

post.description:
Creates a *Cart*.

**Required Fields**
* line_items object
* gift_certificates object â€“ Only if adding a gift certificate to for shopper purchase

**Notes**

Cart ID is generated in the response.

When creating a cart it is recommended to use the option id and option value.

To add a product with a mix of variants and options, the `optionSelections` need to be listed out separately. 

The redirect url endpoint does not work using the Storefront Cart. At this time, shoppers can not be directed to any carts or checkouts created using the Storefront APIS.

put.description:
Updates a *Cart* line item. Updates an existing, single line item in the cart.

**Notes**

Currently only updating the item quantity is supported.

If a variant needs to be changed or updated, the product will need to be removed and re-added to the cart with the correct variants using the [Add Cart Line Items](/api-reference/cart-checkout/storefront-cart-api/cart/addcartlineitem) endpoint.

delete.description:
Deletes a *Cart* line item.

**Notes**

Removing the last `line_item` in the *Cart* deletes the *Cart*.

parameters.name: cartId
parameters.description: This cart's unique ID.

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description: The ID of the item to delete.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
To return product options add one of the following include:

`lineItems.physicalItems.options`: The Cart returns an abbreviated result. Use this to return physical items product options. Can also be used in a /POST to have the extended Cart object return.

`lineItems.digitalItems.options`:  The Cart returns an abbreviated result. Use this to return digital items product options.  Can also be used in a /POST to have the extended Cart object return.

`lineItems.digitalItems.options,lineItems.physicalItems.options`:  The Cart returns an abbreviated result. Use this to return digital and physical options. Can also be used in a /POST to have the extended Cart object return.

info.title: Storefront Checkouts
info.description:
### Checkout
The Storefront Checkout does not use API Tokens and allows for Checkout data to be scraped directly from the front end or used in a Stencil Theme.

Note:
* The Try It Now at each endpoint will not work. Please see [Cart and Checkout](/api-docs/cart-and-checkout/cart-and-checkout-overview) for a script that can be used to get Cart details.
* checkoutId is the same as the cartId.
* The redirect url endpoint does not work using the Storefront Cart. At this time shoppers can not be directed to any carts or checkouts created using the Storefront APIS.

get.description:
Returns a *Checkout*.

**Notes**

The cart ID and checkout ID are the same.

items.description:
Add a custom item to the shoppers cart. 
* Custom items are not added to the catalog.
* The price should be set to match the store settings for taxes.

name.description: Item name

listPrice.description: Price of the item. With or without tax depending on your stores set up.

fieldValue.description: This can also be an array for fields that need to support list of values (e.g., a set of check boxes.)

items.title: Consignment
items.description: This allows us to have multiple shipping addresses. Where there is only one shipping address, this array will contain only one value, with all the items.

fieldValue.description: This can also be an array for fields that need to support list of values (e.g., a set of check boxes.)

availableShippingOptions.description: This is available only when "include=consignments.availableShippingOptions" is presented in the URL.

transitTime.description: An estimate of the arrival time.

name.description: Item name

put.description:
Updates a *Checkout Line Item*. Updates an existing, single line item in the cart.

**Notes** 

If a variant needs to be changed or updated, the product will need to be removed and re-added to the cart with the correct variants using the [Add Cart Line Items](SF Cart Line Items) endpoint.

* email
* country_code

items.title: CustomField
items.description: When doing a PUT or POST to the `fieldValue` with a pick list, the input must be a number. The response will be a string.

fieldValue.description: This can also be an array for fields that need to support list of values (e.g., a set of check boxes.). When doing a PUT or POST to the `fieldValue` with a pick list, the input must be a number. The response will be a string.

post.description:
Adds a new *Consignment* to *Checkout*.

There are two steps to add a new shipping address and shipping options with line items. 
1. Add a new Consignment to Checkout.
	2. Send a POST to Consignments with each shipping address and line items IDs. Each address can have its own line item IDs.
	3. As part of the request URL make sure to add `include=consignments.availableShippingOptions` to return the available shipping options based on line items and shipping locations. This will return `availableShippingOptions` in the response.
3. [Update the Consignment](/api-reference/cart-checkout/storefront-checkout-api/checkout/checkoutsconsignmentsbycheckoutidandconsignmentidput) with Shipping Options.

**Required Query**
* consignments.availableShippingOptions

**Required Fields**
* shipping_address
* line_items

To learn more about creating a Checkout Consignment see [Working with the Fetch API](/api-docs/cart-and-checkout/working-sf-apis).

put.description:
Updates an existing consignment. Shipping address, line item IDs or the shipping option ID can be updated using this endpoint.

There are two steps to add a new shipping address and shipping options with line items. 
1. Add a [new Consignment](/api-reference/cart-checkout/storefront-checkout-api/checkout/checkoutsconsignmentsbycheckoutidpost) to Checkout.
3. [Update the Consignment](/api-reference/cart-checkout/storefront-checkout-api/checkout/checkoutsconsignmentsbycheckoutidandconsignmentidput) with Shipping Options.
	4. Update each *Consignment* `shippingOptionId` (shipping address and line items) with the `availableShippingOption > id` from Step One. 

**Required Fields**
* shippingOptionId

To learn more about creating a Checkout Consignment see [Working with the Fetch API](/api-docs/cart-and-checkout/working-sf-apis).

**Notes**
* You cannot pass both a `shippingAddress` and `shippingOptionId` because the shipping option may not be able to be applied to the given address

schema.title: Update Consignment Request
schema.description: One or more of these three fields are mandatory. Shipping address and line items can be updated in one request. Shipping option ID has to be updated in a separate request, since changing the address or line items can invalidate the previously available shipping options.

cart.title: Cart
cart.description: A cart contains a collection of items, prices, discounts, etc. It does not contain customer-related data.

id.description: Cart ID, provided after creating a cart with a POST.

customer_id.description: ID of the customer to which the cart belongs.

email.description: The cart's email. This is the same email that is used in the billing address

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: The currency which prices are displayed (the store default currency).

name.description: The currency name.

decimalPlaces.description: Number of decimal places for the currency. For example, USD currency has two decimal places.

taxIncluded.description: Boolean representing whether tax information is included.

baseAmount.description: Cost of cart's contents, before applying discounts.

discountAmount.description: Discounted amount.

cartAmount.description: Sum of line-items amounts, minus cart-level discounts and coupons. This amount includes taxes (where applicable).

displayName.description: The coupon title based on different types provided in control panel section

couponType.description: Key name to identify the type of coupon.

discountedAmount.description: The discounted amount applied within a given context.

name.description: The name provided by the merchant.

discountedAmount.description: The discounted amount applied within a given context.

parentId.description: The product is part of a bundle such as a product pick list, then the parentId or the main product id will populate.

name.description: The item's product name.

imageUrl.description: URL of an image of this item, accessible on the internet.

discounts.description: List of discounts applied to this item, as an array of AppliedDiscount objects.

name.description: The name provided by the merchant.

discountedAmount.description: The discounted amount applied within a given context.

discountAmount.description: The total value of all discounts applied to this item (excluding coupon).

couponAmount.description: The total value of all coupons applied to this item.

listPrice.description: Item's list price, as quoted by the manufacturer/distributor.

salePrice.description: Item's price after all discounts are applied. (The final price before tax calculation.)

extendedListPrice.description: Item's list price multiplied by the quantity.

extendedSalePrice.description: Item's sale price multiplied by the quantity.

type.description: the product type - physical or digital

addedByPromotion.description: If the item was added automatically by a promotion such as a coupon or buy one, get one.

isShippingRequired.description: Whether this item requires shipping to a physical address.

parentId.description: Bundled items will have their parent's item Id.

items.title: Item Custom
items.description:
Add a custom item to the shoppers cart. 
* Custom items are not added to the catalog.
* The price should be set to match the store settings for taxes.

name.description: Item name

listPrice.description: Price of the item. With or without tax depending on your stores set up.

createdTime.description: Time when the cart was created.

updatedTime.description: Time when the cart was last updated.

fieldValue.description: This can also be an array for fields that need to support list of values (e.g., a set of check boxes.)

items.title: Consignment
items.description: This allows us to have multiple shipping addresses. Where there is only one shipping address, this array will contain only one value, with all the items.

fieldValue.description: This can also be an array for fields that need to support list of values (e.g., a set of check boxes.)

availableShippingOptions.description: This is available only when "include=consignments.availableShippingOptions" is presented in the URL.

type.description: Specified the type of shipping option. Flat rate, UPS, etc.,

transitTime.description: An estimate of the arrival time.

additionalDescription.description: ReadOnly, Field used for Shipping Provider API.

isRecommended.description: Is this shipping method the recommended shipping option or not.

type.description: Specified the type of shipping option. Flat rate, UPS, etc.,

transitTime.description: An estimate of the arrival time.

additionalDescription.description: ReadOnly, Field used for Shipping Provider API.

couponDiscounts.description: List of consignment discounts applied through coupons

code.description: Coupon code that applied this discount

discounts.description: List of consignment discounts applied through cart level discounts

id.description: Discount rule ID that applied this discount

shippingCost.description: The shipping cost for this consignment.

handlingCost.description: The handling cost of shipping for this consignment.

displayName.description: The coupon title based on different types provided in control panel section

couponType.description:
|Type `int`|Type Name|
|-|-|
|`0`|`per_item_discount`|
|`1`|`percentage_discount`|
|`2`|`per_total_discount`|
|`3`|`shipping_discount`|
|`4`|`free_shipping`|
|`5`|`promotion`|

discountedAmount.description: The discounted amount applied within a given context.

shippingCostTotal.description: Shipping cost before any discounts are applied.

handlingCostTotal.description: Handling cost for all consignments including or excluding tax.

name.description: Name of the tax charged. This is either the system default or the custom name created for the tax.

subtotal.description: Subtotal of the checkout before applying item level discounts. Tax inclusive based on the store settings.

grandTotal.description: The total payable amount, before applying any store credit or gift certificate.

giftCertificates.description: Applied gift certificate (as a payment method).

items.title: Gift Certificate
items.description: The values presented here are projections of how much we would be using out of an existent gift certificate

createdTime.description: Time when the cart was created.

updatedTime.description: Time when the cart was last updated.

customerMessage.description: Shopper's message provided as details for the order to be created from this cart

info.title: Storefront Orders
info.description:
## Storefront Orders API
Returns order data immediately after an order is placed on the storefront.

info.title: Carts
info.description:
### Cart
Allows for a cart to be created using BigCommerce cart logic. The existing BigCommerce front end cart can be bypassed.

Notes:
- cartId is the same as the checkoutId.
- Carts are valid for 30 days from the last modification. This can include creating the cart or editing the cart.
- Redirect URLs can be generated only from carts created using the server-to-server cart API. To restore a cart that was created on the storefrontâ€“either by a shopper or the Storefront Cart APIâ€“first recreate the cart using the server-to-server Cart API.

post.description:
Creates a **Cart**. 

**Required Fields**
|Field|Details|
|-|-|
|`line_items`|| 
|`custom_items`||
|`gift_certificates`|Only required if adding gift certificate to cart|

**Usage Notes**

* A **cart** `id` (UUID) is returned in the response.
* To get cart `redirect_urls` in the response, append the following query parameter to the reuest URL: `include=redirect_urls`
* Redirect URLs can only be generated from carts created using the **Server-to-Server Carts API**. 
* To restore a cart that was created by a shopper or via Storefront Cart API, first recreate the cart using the Server to Server Cart API.
* A cart can be created using an existing catalog item, or by adding a custom item using [Item Custom](/api-reference/cart-checkout/server-server-cart-api/models/itemcustom).
* **cart** `id` is the same as the **checkout** `id`.
* Carts are valid for **30 days** from the **last modification** (this includes creating the cart or editing the cart).

parameters.description:
1. Creating a cart by adding a simple product (a product without option selections)
2. Creating a cart with a variant. This works when a product can be specified purely by a variant, without any other required options.
3. With a variant and a checkbox and picklist modifier added.
4. Using a Custom Item

post.description:
Creates a **Cart** redirect URL for redirecting a shopper to an already created cart using the `cartId`.

**Usage Notes**
* Redirect URLs can also be created via **Create a Cart** requests by appending `include=redirect_urls`.
* A **Carts** redirect URLs may only be used once. 
* Once a redirect URL has been visited, it will be invalidated and cannot be used again. 
* If your application requires URLs to be visited more than once, consider generating a fresh one each time you need to restore a cart, and redirecting to the URL from your own application.
* Redirect URLs can be generated only from carts created using the Server to Server Cart API. 
* To restore a cart that was created on the storefront, either by a shopper or the Storefront Cart API, first recreate the cart using the Server to Server Cart API.

put.description:
Updates a *Cart* line item. Updates an existing, single line item in the cart. 

**Notes**
Currently only updating the item price and quantity are supported.

If a variant needs to be changed or updated, the product will need to be removed and re-added to the cart with the correct variants using the Add Cart Line Items endpoint.

put.description:
Updates a *Carts* `customer_id`.

**Notes**

Changing the *Cart* `customer_id` will remove any promotions or shipping on the *Cart*. These are tied to the customer depending on cart conditions and any customer groups.

ItemCustom.title: Item Custom
ItemCustom.description:
Add a custom item to the shoppers cart.

* Custom items are not added to the catalog.
* The price should be set to match the store settings for taxes.

name.description: Item name

list_price.description: Price of the item. With or without tax depending on your stores set up.

X-Auth-Client.name: X-Auth-Client
X-Auth-Client.description:
### OAuth Scopes
|  **UI Name** | **Permission** | **Parameter** |
| --- | --- | --- |
|  Carts | modify | `store_cart` |
|  Carts | read-only | `store_cart_read_only` |

### Headers

|Header|Parameter|Description|
|-|-|-|
|`X-Auth-Client`|`client_id`|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|
|`X-Auth-Token`|`access_token `|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|

### Example

```http
GET /stores/{$$.env.store_hash}/v3/catalog/summary
host: api.bigcommerce.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-Auth-Client: {client_id}
X-Auth-Token: {access_token}
```

* For more information on Authenticating BigCommerce APIs, see: [Authentication](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/getting-started/authentication).

X-Auth-Token.description:

|`X-Auth-Token`|`access_token `|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|

### Example


* For more information on Authenticating BigCommerce APIs, see: [Authentication](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/getting-started/authentication).

line_items.name: include
line_items.description:
* `redirect_urls`: Create a direct link to a Cart. This can be used during the /POST request for Carts.
* `line_items.physical_items.options`: The Cart returns an abbreviated result. Use this to return physical items product options. Can also be used in a /POST to have the extended Cart object return.
* `line_items.digital_items.options`: The Cart returns an abbreviated result. Use this to return digital items product options.  Can also be used in a /POST to have the extended Cart object return.

info.title: Checkouts
info.description:
### Checkout
Allows for a checkout to be created from an existing cart using BigCommerce checkout logic. The existing BigCommerce front end cart/checkout can be bypassed.

Notes:
- checkoutId is the same as the cartId.

get.description:
Returns a *Checkout*.

**Notes**

The cart ID and checkout ID are the same.

post.description:
Adds a new *Consignment* to *Checkout*.


There are two steps to add a new shipping address and shipping options with line items. 
1. Add a new Consignment to Checkout.
	1. Send a POST to Consignments with each shipping address and line items IDs. Each address can have its own line item IDs.
	2. As part of the request URL make sure to add `include=consignments.available_shipping_options` to return the available shipping options based on line items and shipping locations. This will return `available_shipping_options` in the response.
3. [Update the Consignment](/api-reference/cart-checkout/server-server-checkout-api/checkout-consignments/checkoutsconsignmentsbycheckoutidandconsignmentidput) with Shipping Options.

**Required Query**
* consignments.available_shipping_options

**Required Fields**
* shipping_address
* line_items

put.description:
Updates an existing consignment. Shipping address, line item IDs or the shipping option ID can be updated using this endpoint.

There are two steps to add a new shipping address and shipping options with line items. 
1. Add a [new Consignment](/api-reference/cart-checkout/server-server-checkout-api/checkout-consignments/checkoutsconsignmentsbycheckoutidpost) to Checkout.
2. Update the Consignment with Shipping Options.
	1. Update each *Consignment* `shipping_option_id` (shipping address and line items) with the `available_shipping_option > id` from Step One. 


**Required Fields**
* shipping_option_id

parameters.name: checkoutId
parameters.description: Id of the Checkout

schema.title: Update Consignment Request
schema.description: Shipping address and line items can be updated in one request. Line items have to be passed when updating shipping address. Shipping option ID has to be updated in a separate request, since changing the address or line items can invalidate the previously available shipping options.

field_value.description: This can also be an array for fields that need to support list of values (e.g., a set of check boxes.)

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Must be included to get available shipping options

id.description: Cart ID, provided after creating a cart with a POST.

customer_id.description: ID of the customer to which the cart belongs.

email.description: The cart's email. This is the same email that is used in the billing address

base_amount.description: Cost of cart's contents, before applying discounts.

discount_amount.description: Discounted amount.

cart_amount_inc_tax.description: Sum of line-items amounts, minus cart-level discounts and coupons including tax

cart_amount_ex_tax.description: Sum of line-items amounts, minus cart-level discounts and coupons excluding tax

coupon_type.description: Key name to identify the type of coupon.

discounted_amount.description: The discounted amount applied within a given context.
The discounted amount applied within a given context.

name.description: The item's product name.

delete.description:
Removes an existing consignment from checkout. 

Removing the last consigment will remove the Cart from the customer it is assigned to. Create a new rediret url for the customer to access it again.

post.description:
Creates an *Order*. 

**Notes**

Orders created will be set to incomplete order status. 

You can create as many orders from the same order(cart) as you want. Order duplication creates the same order with a new order number with the incomplete status. 
Once the order is paid, then the cart is deleted. Cart deletion occurs if you are using BigCommerce to accept payments on orders.

X-Auth-Client.name: X-Auth-Client
X-Auth-Client.description:
### OAuth Scopes
|  **UI Name** | **Permission** | **Parameter** |
| --- | --- | --- |
|  Checkouts | modify | `store_checkout` |
|  Checkouts | read-only | `store_checkout_read_only` |

### Headers

|Header|Parameter|Description|
|-|-|-|
|`X-Auth-Client`|`client_id`|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|
|`X-Auth-Token`|`access_token `|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|

### Example

```http
GET /stores/{$$.env.store_hash}/v3/catalog/summary
host: api.bigcommerce.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-Auth-Client: {client_id}
X-Auth-Token: {access_token}
```

* For more information on Authenticating BigCommerce APIs, see: [Authentication](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/getting-started/authentication).

info.title: Channels
info.description:
- [OAuth Scopes](#oauth-scopes)
- [Authentication](#authentication)
- [Available Endpoints](#available-endpoints)
- [Usage Notes](#usage-notes)
- [Resources](#resources)

Create and manage product listings for multiple storefronts and sales channels.

## OAuth Scopes
| UI Name                                      | Permission | Parameter                                     |
|----------------------------------------------|------------|-----------------------------------------------|
| Channel Listings                             | modify     | `store_channel_listings`                      |
| Channel Listings                             | read-only  | `store_channel_listings_read_only`            |
| Channel Settings                             | modify     | `store_channel_settings`                      |
| Channel Settings                             | read-only  | `store_channel_settings_read_only`            |

For more information on OAuth Scopes, see: [Authentication](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/getting-started/authentication).

## Authentication

Requests can be authenticated by sending a `client_id` and `access_token` via `X-Auth-Client` and `X-Auth-Token` HTTP headers:

```http
GET /stores/{$$.env.store_hash}/v3/catalog/summary
host: api.bigcommerce.com
Accept: application/json
X-Auth-Client: {client_id}
X-Auth-Token: {access_token}
```

|Header|Parameter|Description|
|-|-|-|
|`X-Auth-Client`|`client_id`|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|
|`X-Auth-Token`|`access_token `|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|

For more information on Authenticating BigCommerce APIs, see: [Authentication](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/getting-started/authentication).

## Available Endpoints
| Resource / Endpoint                     | Description                                                              |
|-----------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Channels                                | Create and manage catalog listings and channels                          |
| Channel Site                            | Manage sites and routing for headless storefronts                        |
| Channel Listings                        | Manage catalog differences among different storefronts or marketplaces   |

## Usage Notes

**Channels and Channel Listings:**
* A channel is anywhere a merchant sells their products. This encompasses headless storefronts, marketplaces, POS systems, and marketing platforms.
* Channel listings allow you to manage catalog differences among different storefronts or marketplaces.

**Sites and Site Routes:**
* Sites and routes control the paths that make up a headless storefront
* Site refers to the domain associated with a channel
* Routes point to the URLs for key pages on the headless storefront. They define where your homepage is, where your cart page is, etc.
* Sites and routes ensure links point where theyâ€™re supposed to and sales are attributed correctly. For example, a shopperâ€™s order confirmation email should link back to Storefront A, where they placed their order, not Storefront B, which theyâ€™ve never visited.

## Resources

### Related Endpoints
* [Sites](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-reference/cart-checkout/sites-routes-api)

tags.name: Channels
tags.description: Enables creation and management of additional channels, such as marketplaces, POS, and 3rd-party storefronts, where a merchant can list their products to sell.

tags.name: Channel Listings
tags.description: Enables creation and management of product listings, the representation of a product from a merchant's catalog on a specific sales channel.

Determines whether the channel is enabled on a store. In order to disable a channel, set is_enabled to false.

This results in the channel not showing in the 'Products' section of the BC control panel.

post.description:
Creates a *Channel*.

**Required Fields**
* `type`
* `platform`
* `name`

**Usage Notes**

Type & platform combination must be a valid pair:

| Platform          | Accepted Type             |
|-------------------|---------------------------|
| `square `         | `pos`                     |
| `vend`            | `pos`                     |
| `clover`          | `pos`                     |
| `facebook`        | `marketplace`,`marketing` |
| `amazon`          | `marketplace`             |
| `ebay`            | `marketplace`             |

get.description:
Alias of GET /sites?channel_id=channel_id

Returns site data for given channel

url.description: The Fully Qualified URL (including host and scheme) where this site is hosted. All URLs generated for this site will be appended to this.

channel_id.description: The channel this site is attached to. Each site belongs to a single channel, and each channel can have either zero or one sites.

created_at.description: When was this site created? RFC 3339

updated_at.description: When was this site defintion last updated? RFC 3339

routes.description: (optional - if included) collection of routes defined for this site. Limited to 200 routes side loaded (query routes direction via `/routes` for bulk)

id.description: Unique ID for this route. Required when updating an existing route

type.description: What type of resource are we routing to?

matching.description:
(entity_id?) For a given type, which resources should match this route? e.g For a route with the type: "product" and matching: "5" this route would be used for the product with the ID of 5. 

Depending on the type of resource, this may be an ID (matching a specific item), or a "*" wildcard matching all items of that type.

route.description:
The route template that will be used to generate the URL for the requested resource.

Supports several tokens:

- {id} The ID of the requested item
- {slug} The slug for the requested item (if available). Note: the `slug` value may contain `/` slash
- {language} The language string that the client is using

X-Auth-Client.name: X-Auth-Client
X-Auth-Client.description:
### OAuth Scopes
|  **UI Name** | **Permission** | **Parameter** |
| --- | --- | --- |
|  Channel Listings | modify | `store_channel_listings` |
|  Channel Listings | read-only | `store_channel_listings_read_only` |
|  Channel Settings | modify | `store_channel_settings` |
|  Channel Settings | read-only | `store_channel_settings_read_only` |
|  Sites & Routes | modify | `store_sites` |
|  Sites & Routes | read-only | `store_sites_read_only` |

### Headers

|Header|Parameter|Description|
|-|-|-|
|`X-Auth-Client`|`client_id`|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|
|`X-Auth-Token`|`access_token `|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|

### Example

```http
GET /stores/{$$.env.store_hash}/v3/catalog/summary
host: api.bigcommerce.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-Auth-Client: {client_id}
X-Auth-Token: {access_token}
```

* For more information on Authenticating BigCommerce APIs, see: [Authentication](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/getting-started/authentication).

info.title: Sites
info.description:
- [OAuth Scopes](#oauth-scopes)
- [Authentication](#authentication)
- [Available Endpoints](#available-endpoints)
- [Usage Notes](#usage-notes)
- [Resources](#resources)

Create and manage sites and routes for headless storefronts.

## OAuth Scopes
| UI Name        | Permission | Parameter               |
|----------------|------------|-------------------------|
| Sites & Routes | modify     | `store_sites`           |
| Sites & Routess| read-only  | `store_sites_read_only` |

For more information on OAuth Scopes, see: [Authentication](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/getting-started/authentication).

## Authentication

Requests can be authenticated by sending a `client_id` and `access_token` via `X-Auth-Client` and `X-Auth-Token` HTTP headers:

```http
GET /stores/{$$.env.store_hash}/v3/catalog/summary
host: api.bigcommerce.com
Accept: application/json
X-Auth-Client: {client_id}
X-Auth-Token: {access_token}
```

|Header|Parameter|Description|
|-|-|-|
|`X-Auth-Client`|`client_id`|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|
|`X-Auth-Token`|`access_token `|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|

For more information on Authenticating BigCommerce APIs, see: [Authentication](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/getting-started/authentication).

## Available Endpoints
| Resource / Endpoint                     | Description                                                              |
|-----------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Channels                                | Create and manage catalog listings and channels                          |
| Channel Site                            | Manage sites and routing for headless storefronts                        |
| Channel Listings                        | Manage catalog differences among different storefronts or marketplaces   |

## Usage Notes

**Sites and Site Routes:**
* Sites and routes control the paths that make up a headless storefront
* Site refers to the domain associated with a channel
* Routes point to the URLs for key pages on the headless storefront. They define where the homepage is, where the cart page is, etc.
* Sites and routes ensure links point where theyâ€™re supposed to and sales are attributed correctly. For example, a shopperâ€™s order confirmation email should link back to Storefront A, where they placed their order, not Storefront B, which theyâ€™ve never visited.

## Resources

### Related Endpoints
* [Channels](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-reference/cart-checkout/channels-listings-api)

post.description:
Currently, within BigCommerce, we support the following route types (meaning we will redirect shoppers back to given routes for these):

* Type: "home"
* Type: "product"
* Type: "cart"
* Type: "checkout"
* Type: "account_order_status" (for order statuses on an account)
* Type: "account_new_return" (for returns on an account)
* Type: "unsubscribe" (for unsubscribe URL in emails)
* Type: "recover_abandoned_cart" (for URL in emails for a shopper to recover their abandoned cart)
* Type: "create_account"
* Type: "forgot_password"
* Type: "order_confirmation" (supported in future update to override order confirmation page)

tags.name: Sites
tags.description: Enables creation and management of external sites (domains) where shoppers shop. Allows for the correct shopping experience to be delivered and maintained (i.e. redirect URLs, email links) when a shopper goes through the purchasing process.

tags.name: Routes
tags.description: Allows for specific page routes to be set so that shoppers can be directed to the proper domain pages in their shopping experience.

### OAuth Scopes

|  Channel Settings | modify | `store_channel_settings` |
|  Channel Settings | read-only | `store_channel_settings_read_only` |

|  Sites & Routes | read-only | `store_sites_read_only` |

### Headers

|Header|Parameter|Description|
|-|-|-|
|`X-Auth-Client`|`client_id`|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|
|`X-Auth-Token`|`access_token `|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|

### Example

```http
GET /stores/{$$.env.store_hash}/v3/catalog/summary
host: api.bigcommerce.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-Auth-Client: {client_id}
X-Auth-Token: {access_token}
```

* For more information on Authenticating BigCommerce APIs, see: [Authentication](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/getting-started/authentication).

info.title: Wishlist
info.description:
## Wishlist API
  
The Wishlist API allows a developer to create and manage customer [Wishlists](https://support.bigcommerce.com/s/article/Wishlists). A Wishlist allows you to see what your customers are interested in and saving on the store. With this information youâ€™ll be able to create targeted campaigns to help merchants grow their business.
Â  Customer API OAuth scopes give you access to Wishlists API. See[OAuth Scopes](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/getting-started/authentication#authentication_oauth-scopes)

post.description:
Creates a [*Wishlist*](/api-reference/customer-subscribers/wishlist-api/models/wishlist) and [*Wishlist Item*](/api-reference/customer-subscribers/wishlist-api/models/wishlistitem). More than one item can be added in the POST.

**Required Fields**
* name
* customer_id

customer_id.description: The customer id.

is_public.description: Whether the wishlist is available to the public.

name.description: The title of the wishlist.

items.description: Array of Wishlist items.

product_id.description: The ID of the product.

variant_id.description: The variant ID of the product.

id.description: Wishlist ID, provided after creating a wishlist with a POST.

customer_id.description: The ID the customer to which the wishlist belongs.

name.description: The Wishlist's name.

is_public.description: Whether the Wishlist is available to the public.

token.description: The token of the Wishlist. This is created internally within BigCommerce. The Wishlist ID is to be used for external apps. Read-Only

items.description: Array of Wishlist items

product_id.description: The ID of the product.

variant_id.description: The variant ID of the item.

X-Auth-Client.name: X-Auth-Client
X-Auth-Client.description:
### OAuth Scopes
|  **UI Name** | **Permission** | **Parameter** |
| --- | --- | --- |
|  Customers | modify | `store_v2_customers` |
|  Customers | read-only | `store_v2_customers_read_only` |

### Headers

|Header|Parameter|Description|
|-|-|-|
|`X-Auth-Client`|`client_id`|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|
|`X-Auth-Token`|`access_token `|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|

### Example

```http
GET /stores/{$$.env.store_hash}/v3/catalog/summary
host: api.bigcommerce.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-Auth-Client: {client_id}
X-Auth-Token: {access_token}
```

* For more information on Authenticating BigCommerce APIs, see: [Authentication](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/getting-started/authentication).
